description: In response to a Freedom of Information Act lawsuit by The New York Times, the government has declassified a 2009 report by five agenciesâ€™ inspectors general about the Stellarwind program, the group of N.S.A. warrantless wiretapping and bulk phone and e-mail records collection activities initiated by President George W. Bush after the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001.
title: Government Releases Once-Secret Report on Post-9/11 Surveillance
title_page: Government Releases Once-Secret Report on Post-9/11 Surveillance - The New York Times
